title: Learning Theories and Cognitive Frameworks
description: Theoretical frameworks that explain how individuals acquire, process, and apply knowledge, including cognitive, constructivist, and metacognitive perspectives.

title: Instructional Design and Pedagogical Frameworks
description: Frameworks guiding the design, implementation, and evaluation of teaching and learning practices, including scaffolding, formative assessment, and inquiry teaching.

title: Disciplinary and Epistemic Frameworks
description: Frameworks addressing the nature, structure, and practices of scientific disciplines and knowledge construction, including epistemic games and disciplinary authenticity.

title: Teacher Knowledge and Professional Development Frameworks
description: Frameworks focusing on teachers' specialized knowledge, professional growth, and instructional decision-making processes.

title: Educational Systems and Organizational Frameworks
description: Frameworks analyzing educational contexts, systemic change, organizational culture, and multi-level influences on teaching and learning.

title: Assessment and Measurement Frameworks
description: Frameworks related to the design, interpretation, and use of assessments and measurement principles in education.

title: Motivation, Affect, and Psychological Frameworks
description: Frameworks addressing learners' beliefs, motivation, mindsets, self-efficacy, and affective factors influencing learning outcomes.

title: Representation and Communication Frameworks
description: Frameworks focusing on the use, generation, and interpretation of multiple representations, language, and discourse in learning and teaching.

title: Complexity, Systems, and Emergence Frameworks
description: Theoretical perspectives emphasizing complex adaptive systems, emergent phenomena, and dynamic interactions in learning and knowledge development.

title: Sociocultural, Identity, Equity and Social Justice Frameworks
description: Frameworks that focus on social, cultural, and community influences on learning and identity development, with an emphasis on power relations, systemic inequities, identity intersections, and inclusive pedagogies.
